metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9050 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the cli_scanpe function in libclamav/pe.c inClamAV before 0.98.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) via a crafted y0da Crypter PE file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9050` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
